find_least_common_color.prompt: find the least common color that exists in the grid

find_top_left_color_index.prompt: find the index of the most top left block that is the corresponding color in the grid

find_min_rows.prompt: find the minimum number of rows above the corresponding row or rows below it

flip_grid_upside_down.code:
def flip_grid_upside_down(input_grid: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    return np.flipud(input_grid)

elementwise_max.code:
def elementwise_max(input_grid1: np.ndarray, input_grid2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    return np.maximum(input_grid1, input_grid2)

flip_rows_below.code:
def flip_rows_below(input_grid: np.ndarray, row: int) -> np.ndarray:
    num = "find the minimum number of rows above the corresponding row or rows below it"(input_grid, row)
    sub_grid = input_grid[row - num:row + num + 1, :]
    sub_grid_flip = "flip the grid upside down"(sub_grid)
    sub_grid_out = "element-wise maximum"(sub_grid, sub_grid_flip)
    output_grid = np.copy(input_grid)
    output_grid[row - num:row + num + 1, :] = sub_grid_out
    return output_grid

find_min_columns.prompt: find the minimum number of columns left to the corresponding column or columns right to it

flip_grid_left_right.code:
def flip_grid_left_right(input_grid: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    return np.fliplr(input_grid)

flip_columns_right.code:
def flip_columns_right(input_grid: np.ndarray, col: int) -> np.ndarray:
    num = "find the minimum number of columns left to the corresponding column or columns right to it"(input_grid, col)
    sub_grid = input_grid[:, col - num:col + num + 1]
    sub_grid_flip = "flip the grid left-right"(sub_grid)
    sub_grid_out = "element-wise maximum"(sub_grid, sub_grid_flip)
    output_grid = np.copy(input_grid)
    output_grid[:, col - num:col + num + 1] = sub_grid_out
    return output_grid

main.code:
def main(input_grid: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    color = "find the least common color that exists in the grid"(input_grid)
    x, y = "find the index of the most top left block that is the corresponding color in the grid"(input_grid, color)
    x, y = (x + 1, y + 1)
    output_grid = np.copy(input_grid)
    output_grid = flip_rows_below(output_grid, x)
    output_grid = flip_columns_right(output_grid, y)
    return output_grid
